issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
During multiple tries using different iPad 2 devices running the same application that displays a PDF that is locally saved inside of a webview the performance navigating the same document is much slower in responses to touches using iOS 4.3x.  

http://developer.appcelerator.com/question/126984/ios-5-web-view-loading-local-pdf-file-is-greatly-different-in-performance

Example video demonstration with same document, running on iPad 2s.  Slower version is running iOS 4.3x.
http://vimeo.com/30710255
fields.summary: PDF performance on WebViewer is different between iOS 4.3x and iOS 5
fields.environment: iOS 4.3x and iOS 5.x running on iPad 2

comments.body:
William

It is typical for there to be performance benefits gained by upgrading to newer revisions of both ours and 3rd party products.

While I understand it may be frustrating, I am afraid this is not something we can investigate in this instance.

Thanks for your understanding.
